summary.originalText: Must watch

originalText.plaidHtml:
Amazing movie with lots of facts that are unexpected, reality checks and the unexpected goosebumps in between my goodness.

The way terrorist plan, their supply chain, their contacts and support from politics and all was well depicted The contribution of our Indian soldiers, spy, agents who risks their life for our safety and security without worrying about themselves is just unbelievable.

Hat's off to the director producer writer üî•

summary.originalText: Amazing watch

originalText.plaidHtml: After long time i watched something good produced by bollywood. If you're into thriller and spy related stuff then you're going to love this movie don't get fooled by fave review on different platform and Even after 3.30 hrs when it ends and informs you the sequel will come 3 months later, you want more. That's where it wins.

summary.originalText: BEST

originalText.plaidHtml: Can't wait for Aditya Dhar to release the second part already! Too good of a movie. Watch it. With his previous movies as well, the guy knows how to tell a story, and what a story he has told. Had the second parter come out would've sat through that movie as well. The negative comments are just people who are coping. Let them lolol couldn't recommended the movie more.

summary.originalText: Finally, A good indian spy flick

originalText.plaidHtml:
The movie doesn't shy away from the reality of espionage, handles the motivations of the characters and consequences of their actions with a certain edge to it that makes it stand out.

MY biggest relief when I watched it was when I saw that there were no item dance numbers with supposed enemies playing hooky with each other like some (somohow well recieved) Indian spy films have done.

It shows the gritty reality of people engaged in brutal enemity, of nationalistic purpose and the sacrifices that come with it. QUite refreshing indeed and that's the reason for my high rating.

summary.originalText: Truth served best to the face

originalText.plaidHtml:
Not Madhvan , Not Ranveer and Not even Akshay Khanna ....

The real STAR of this eye-opener movie is the SCRIPT.

True to the best it can be keeping in mind the spice one needs to add to make a movie interesting...

If you take out the love mush-mush between Ranveer and that girl , rest of the movie is spine-chilling .

summary.originalText: An Explosive Mix of Action and Feelings

originalText.plaidHtml: The brilliance of Dhurandhar lies in its seamless combination of direction and performance. The director orchestrates a sprawling story across political, action, and emotional landscapes without ever losing clarity. The lead actors bring immense depth to their roles, their expressions and delivery adding gravitas to every scene. Even minor characters are portrayed with precision, making the world feel alive. The action sequences are not just visually stunning but narratively important, executed with a realism that enhances the stakes. Directional choices, from camera angles to scene transitions, amplify the performances, resulting in a gripping cinematic journey. Dhurandhar proves that strong direction and powerful acting together can create unforgettable storytelling.

summary.originalText: When the screen becomes a battleground of talent

originalText.plaidHtml: From the opening sequence, Dhurandhar establishes a tense, immersive atmosphere. Ranveer Singh shines in moments of quiet introspection and explosive confrontation alike, demonstrating remarkable range. Director Dhar's narrative skill lies in juxtaposing high-octane action with morally complex scenarios, making the story feel both thrilling and intellectually engaging. Each supporting actor contributes to the intricacy of the world, ensuring the underworld feels lived-in and authentic. The cinematography enhances the narrative with careful framing, while the background score amplifies suspense without overshadowing performance.

summary.originalText: Good movie with lots of errors !

originalText.plaidHtml:
I expected hyper-nationalism, but the director was witty enough to avoid such cringe. The subject was very interesting, and the performances by all the actors were great. The screenplay could have been better, though.

However, the major flaws were in the art direction. Although Pakistan was portrayed almost correctly, the movie could have been much better with more accurate detailing. I noticed a Bajaj Pulsar, Bajaj Auto rickshaw (during a major sequence), and Tata buses and trucks - automobiles found here in India, not Pakistan. With the kind of budget they spent, they could have created a far more realistic portrayal of Pakistan.

summary.originalText: Best Spy Movie Globally in the last 2 decades

originalText.plaidHtml: Absolute masterclass in movie making. The intensity and yet not a dull moment, makes this a masterpiece in movie making. Every actor has outperformed their entire career. The dark, yet relatable Ranvir, the likable psychopath Akshay Khanna, the leach of a politicial Rajat Bedi, the stylish likable violent Pakistani Police Man Sanjay Dutt and disgusting Arjun Rampal. Brilliance.

summary.originalText: A Gripping Mix of Star Power and Drama

originalText.plaidHtml: The tension in this film slowly tightens around you, refusing to release its grip until the credits roll. Ranveer Singh delivers a performance layered with nuance, perfectly capturing moral ambiguity, while Sanjay Dutt brings a weathered gravitas that commands attention in every frame. Akshaye Khanna, R Madhavan, and Arjun Rampal add depth and unpredictability, each contributing to a story where every choice feels consequential. Sara Arjun's presence provides a poignant contrast, her innocence highlighting the stakes of a world steeped in power and betrayal. Aditya Dhar's direction balances meticulous world-building with adrenaline-pumping sequences, ensuring that the long runtime never feels indulgent. The cinematography captures Karachi's underworld with eerie authenticity, and the sound design amplifies tension without overshadowing the performances. The film's second half escalates beautifully, delivering both spectacle and emotional resonance that lingers long after the screen goes dark.

summary.originalText: Best Bollywood patriotic movie

originalText.plaidHtml:
This is hands down the best patriotic type of movie I have seen.

Dhurandar delivers a tightly packed thriller with sharp pacing, gritty performances, and a storyline that keeps tension high throughout. The direction is confident, visuals are polished, and the twists land effectively. A solid, engaging watch that maintains suspense until the end.

summary.originalText: Thrilling To Watch, Moving To Feel

originalText.plaidHtml: Dhurandhar is a perfect convergence of masterful direction and stellar acting. The lead delivers a performance full of intensity, subtle emotion, and commanding presence, while the supporting cast adds depth and texture to the narrative. The director's vision is clear in every sequence, balancing complex political and underworld plots with personal drama and character arcs. The screenplay is smart, layered, and suspenseful, ensuring that tension builds naturally throughout. Action scenes are sharp and realistic, dialogue is crisp and meaningful, and the cinematography captures both grandeur and intimacy. Real-world references enhance authenticity, making the stakes feel tangible. Overall, Dhurandhar is a landmark film that highlights the heights that exceptional direction and dedicated performances can achieve.

summary.originalText: casting,

originalText.plaidHtml:
Amazing performance by all actors and what a faadu action, story line screen play top notch ,awasome music.... overall full of entertainment movie must watch...
Akshay Khanna Acting nailed every thing...Madhvan intense look so defining character, Sunjay dutt as usual..sab pe bhari...and Rakesh Bedi what a show man..

summary.originalText: Stars Commanding the Screen with Pure Intensity

originalText.plaidHtml: The film immerses viewers in a world of danger and moral ambiguity. Ranveer Singh delivers a masterful performance, seamlessly transitioning between vulnerability and determination. Sanjay Dutt brings gravitas and menace, while Akshaye Khanna and R Madhavan contribute intelligent, layered portrayals. Arjun Rampal's quiet intimidation contrasts beautifully with Sara Arjun's emotional authenticity. Aditya Dhar directs with precision, blending strategy, suspense, and action seamlessly. Cinematography captures chaos and intimate moments alike, and the score heightens tension. By the second half, stakes escalate into a gripping, emotionally resonant climax.

summary.originalText: Best movie of the Decade

originalText.plaidHtml:
Dhurandhar isn't just a film, it's an experience that stays with you long after the credits roll. In a decade filled with big budget spectacles and formulaic blockbusters, this movie stands out with pure storytelling brilliance.

From the very first frame, Dhurandhar grips you with its atmosphere, its magnetic performances, and its razor-sharp writing. The director's vision shines through every scene, balancing intensity, emotion, and suspense with flawless precision. The lead actor delivers a career-defining performance, embodying the character with such depth that you forget you're watching fiction.

What sets Dhurandhar apart is how effortlessly it blends mass appeal with artful filmmaking. The pacing never falters, the soundtrack elevates every moment, and the cinematography turns even the simplest scenes into visual poetry.

The last 30 minutes? Goosebumps. Absolute goosebumps.

If there is one movie this decade that deserves to be called a masterpiece, it's Dhurandhar. This film raises the bar and reminds us what great cinema truly looks like.

A must-watch. A modern classic. The best movie of the decade.

summary.originalText: One Of Its Kind!

originalText.plaidHtml: This is the real espionage movie, a must-watch. Showing the reality of terrorism and the life of a spy in the best realistic way. Hat's off to the makers. Overall, a complete package with the best suitable music and background music that amplifies the scenes. Everyone in the movie acts perfectly. This movie is a milestone in Indian cinema.

summary.originalText: An Emotion-Charged Adventure of Epic Action

originalText.plaidHtml: Every moment is charged with suspense, strategy, and raw emotion, creating a captivating cinematic journey. The lead's performance is magnetic, balancing intellectual acumen with visceral physicality. Action sequences are choreographed to perfection, serving both spectacle and story. Supporting characters leave indelible impressions, adding layers to the narrative. Visuals alternate seamlessly between grandeur and intimate tension. The score intensifies emotions without overpowering the scenes. The screenplay's blend of political intrigue, personal stakes, and underworld conflicts ensures a gripping story. By the finale, the tension and emotional resonance peak perfectly, leaving a lasting cinematic impression.

summary.originalText: Wonderful movie crazy edit

originalText.plaidHtml:
What a movie eating for 2 part. Durandar isn't just a film it's a full blown cinematic punch that refuses to let you breathe. From the first frame, the movie reminds you exactly why mass cinema exists: to make you whistle, clap, scream, and forget the world for 3.5 hours. What a movie. And honestly, after watching it, you'll find yourself waiting for Part 2 like your life depends on it. Durandar isn't just a film - it's a full-blown cinematic punch that refuses to let you breathe. From the first explosive frame, the movie reminds you exactly why mass cinema exists: to make you whistle, clap, scream, and forget the world for 3.5 straight hours.

What works instantly is the film's unapologetic confidence. It doesn't waste a second convincing you of its madness - it throws you right into a world charged with intensity, swagger, and relentless momentum. The hero's presence is electric, the kind that makes the audience whistle even before he says a word. And the film milks that aura brilliantly without ever feeling repetitive.

The writing keeps things tight and engaging. Even without revealing a single plot point, it's fair to say the film balances drama, action, and emotion with a surprisingly smooth flow. Every scene feels like it's building toward something bigger, making you lean forward, curious about what the next punch, line, or twist will bring.

The music and background score deserve their own applause. They elevate ordinary moments into goosebump-worthy experiences and turn high-voltage scenes into pure euphoria. Cinematography is equally charged, capturing mass action with clarity and style.

What truly makes Durandar stand out is its energy. It doesn't drop. Not even for a moment. This is the kind of film that celebrates heroism in its most dramatic form, yet still keeps enough emotional depth to stay grounded.

Verdict: An explosive, addictive, high-octane entertainer that grips you from start to finish. If you love mass cinema, this one will stay with you long after the credits roll.

summary.originalText: Fantastic

originalText.plaidHtml:
Dhurandhar is a well-crafted and fantastic movie. I truly appreciated the powerful storytelling, brilliant performances, and engaging direction. The film is gripping, emotionally stirring, and immensely entertaining from start to finish. Absolutely a fantastic movie - just go watch it!

Highly recommended üòäüòäüòä

summary.originalText: A Gritty, Gripping Tribute to India's Unsung Heroes

originalText.plaidHtml:
Dhurandhar is not just a film, it's an experience that drags you straight into the raw, unpolished world of spycraft and political espionage. What truly sets it apart is its unapologetic honesty; it doesn't glamorize the life of an agent, but instead shows the harsh, chilling, and often heartbreaking reality behind the shadows they operate in.

Ranveer Singh delivers a phenomenal performance as Hamza Ali Mazhari (also a potential connection to Aditya Dhar's directed movie URI), a character inspired by multiple real-life missions carried out by India's intelligence community. While the role is fictionalized, it carries the soul, grit, and silent bravery of countless RAW operatives who have risked everything for the country. His portrayal feels lived-in every expression, every decision, every moment of anguish reflects the weight of duty these agents carry.

The film keeps you on edge, giving you chills, anger, even helplessness at times, only to later reward you with the deep satisfaction of justice served. It's a powerful reminder of the immense horror, danger, and emotional toll an agent undergoes, and yet how firmly they stand by their kartavya.

A special mention must go to Aditya Dhar. His direction is sharp, immersive, and respectful. The execution is top-tier, and the storytelling stays true to the spirit of those unsung heroes. He balances intensity with emotion, ensuring the narrative never loses its heart.

In short: Dhurandhar is a must watch.

A bold, gripping, and honorable tribute to the brave individuals who protect the nation from the shadows.

summary.originalText: #Dhurandhar = CLASS + MASS

originalText.plaidHtml:
What a film. What an experience.

#Dhurandhar = CLASS + MASS. Ranveer ruled every frame, Akshaye Khanna stunned with his screen presence.

This one's a definite SUPERHIT.

Don't miss it.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê #DhurandharKaDhamaka.

Why you should watch Durandhar:

  • It's based on a real story.


  • Every character fits the actor playing the role.


  • It shows how Pakistan executed terrorist attacks in India (2007, 26/11).


  • It highlights how fake Indian currency was pushed into the country.


#Dhurandhar

  • The cast is stacked: Ranveer, Akshaye Khanna, R. Madhavan, Rakesh Bedi, Arjun Rampal, and Sanjay Dutt.


#DhurandharReview #DhurandharKaDhamaka.

summary.originalText: Thrills That Surge and Emotions That Sink Deep

originalText.plaidHtml: The film crafts a compelling narrative that balances intrigue, suspense, and action. Ranveer Singh delivers a complex performance, embodying internal conflict and resilience, while Sanjay Dutt provides commanding authority. Akshaye Khanna and R Madhavan elevate supporting roles with subtlety, and Arjun Rampal adds quiet menace that keeps audiences on edge. Sara Arjun's emotional scenes make the stakes tangible. Aditya Dhar's direction integrates suspense, plot twists, and high-octane action seamlessly. Cinematography captures both urban scale and intimate moments, and the score accentuates every beat of tension. The finale is both thrilling and emotionally satisfying.

summary.originalText: A Thrilling Tale Where Every Scene Hits Hard

originalText.plaidHtml: From start to finish, the film immerses viewers in a high-stakes world of crime, politics, and personal dilemmas. Ranveer Singh delivers a nuanced, emotionally rich performance, while Sanjay Dutt exudes authority and menace. Akshaye Khanna and R Madhavan provide layered and compelling support, and Arjun Rampal's quiet intensity enhances tension. Sara Arjun adds poignancy and emotional grounding. Under Aditya Dhar's direction, suspense and action escalate naturally, with cinematography and sound design amplifying the story's impact. By the second half, the film combines adrenaline, emotion, and intellectual engagement, culminating in a powerful, unforgettable climax.

summary.originalText: The much needed Spy film

originalText.plaidHtml:
The movie is long but doesn't feel like it. The BGM is amazing, it hooks you to the pacing scenes fight scenes. You should go and watch it in theaters.

Every character played their roles perfectly. Akshay Khanna's stood out amongst them. I never thought I would be able to violence like daredevil or punisher in Indian movies.

summary.originalText: Best Movie, Top in Genre, One of the Best movie of all time

originalText.plaidHtml:
Full action packed, great performance by all the actors, Trilling, Best cinematography, Awesome BGM, Music wise one of the best, Story writing dialogs are topnotch, Great Direction, the best movie on the subject, and visually very good experience, easily one of the best movie of all time

Overall a must watch movie in theaters...
